proteusPy.DisulfideList 

  1# DisulfideList Class definition
  2# I extend UserList to handle lists of Disulfide objects.
  3# Indexing and slicing are supported, sorting is based on energy
  4# Author Eric G. Suchanek, PhD
  5# A part of the proteusPy molecular modeling and analysis suite by
  6# Eric G. Suchanek, PhD
  7# Last modification: 12/13/2023 -egs-
  8
  9import pandas as pd
 10import tqdm

 12import proteusPy
 13from proteusPy import *
 14from proteusPy.atoms import *
 15
 16import pyvista as pv
 17from collections import UserList
 18from tqdm import tqdm

 20_PBAR_COLS = 100
 21
 22def atest():
 23    '''
 24    Calculate rows and columns for the given needed to display
 25    a given number of disulfides in a square aspect.
 26
 27    :param n: int Number of Disulfides
 28    :param y: int Number of Disulfides
 29    :return: int rows, columns
 30    '''
 31    return
 32
 33def grid_dimensions(n):
 34    '''
 35    Calculate rows and columns for the given needed to display
 36    a given number of disulfides in a square aspect.
 37
 38    Parameters
 39    ----------
 40    n : int
 41        Number of Disulfides
 42    y : float
 43        Number of bosons
 44
 45    Returns
 46    -------
 47    int
 48        rows, columns
 49    '''
 50    
 51    root = math.sqrt(n)
 52    # If the square root is a whole number, return that as the number of rows and columns
 53    if root == int(root):
 54        return int(root), int(root)
 55    # If the square root is not a whole number, round up and return that as the number of columns
 56    # and calculate the number of rows as the number of images divided by the number of columns
 57    else:
 58        columns = math.ceil(root)
 59        return int(n / columns), int(columns)
 60
 61Torsion_DF_Cols = ['source', 'ss_id', 'proximal', 'distal', 'chi1', 'chi2', 'chi3', 'chi4', \
 62           'chi5', 'energy', 'ca_distance', 'phi_prox', 'psi_prox', 'phi_dist',\
 63           'psi_dist', 'torsion_length']
 64
 65Distance_DF_Cols = ['source', 'ss_id', 'proximal', 'distal', 'energy', 'ca_distance']
 66
 67class DisulfideList(UserList):
 68    '''
 69    Class provides a sortable list for Disulfide objects.
 70    Indexing and slicing are supported, and normal list operations like 
 71    .insert, .append and .extend. The DisulfideList object must be initialized 
 72    with an iterable (tuple, list) and a name.
 73    
 74    The class can also render Disulfides to a pyVista window using the 
 75    DisulfideList.display() method. See below for examples.\n
 76
 77    Examples:
 78    >>> from proteusPy.Disulfide import Disulfide 
 79    >>> from proteusPy.DisulfideLoader import DisulfideLoader
 80    >>> from proteusPy.DisulfideList import DisulfideList
 81        
 82    Instantiate some variables. Note: the list is initialized with an iterable and a name (optional)
 83
 84    >>> SS = Disulfide('tmp')
 85    >>> SSlist = DisulfideList([],'ss')
 86
 87    >>> PDB_SS = DisulfideLoader(verbose=False, subset=True)  # load the Disulfide database
 88    >>> SS = PDB_SS[0]              # returns a Disulfide object at index 0
 89    >>> SS
 90    <Disulfide 4yys_22A_65A SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 22 A Distal: 65 A>
 91    >>> SS4yys = PDB_SS['4yys']     # returns a DisulfideList containing all
 92    >>> SS4yys
 93    [<Disulfide 4yys_22A_65A SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 22 A Distal: 65 A>, <Disulfide 4yys_56A_98A SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 56 A Distal: 98 A>, <Disulfide 4yys_156A_207A SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 156 A Distal: 207 A>, <Disulfide 4yys_22B_65B SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 22 B Distal: 65 B>, <Disulfide 4yys_56B_98B SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 56 B Distal: 98 B>, <Disulfide 4yys_156B_207B SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 156 B Distal: 207 B>]
 94
 95    Make some empty disulfides
 96    >>> ss1 = Disulfide('ss1')
 97    >>> ss2 = Disulfide('ss2')
 98
 99    Make a DisulfideList containing ss1, named 'tmp'
100    >>> sslist = DisulfideList([ss1], 'tmp')
101    >>> sslist.append(ss2)
102
103    Extract the first disulfide
104    >>> ss1 = PDB_SS[0]
105    >>> ss1.pprint_all()
106    <Disulfide 4yys_22A_65A SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 22 A Distal: 65 A
107     Proximal Chain fullID: <('4yys', 0, 'A', (' ', 22, ' '))> Distal Chain fullID: <('4yys', 0, 'A', (' ', 65, ' '))> 
108    Proximal Coordinates:
109       N: <Vector -2.36, -20.48, 5.21>
110       CÎ±: <Vector -2.10, -19.89, 3.90>
111       C: <Vector -1.12, -18.78, 4.12>
112       O: <Vector -1.30, -17.96, 5.03>
113       CÎ²: <Vector -3.38, -19.31, 3.32>
114       SÎ³: <Vector -3.24, -18.40, 1.76>
115       Cprev <Vector -2.67, -21.75, 5.36>
116       Nnext: <Vector -0.02, -18.76, 3.36>
117     Distal Coordinates:
118       N: <Vector -0.60, -18.71, -1.62>
119       CÎ±: <Vector -0.48, -19.10, -0.22>
120       C: <Vector 0.92, -19.52, 0.18>
121       O: <Vector 1.10, -20.09, 1.25>
122       CÎ²: <Vector -1.48, -20.23, 0.08>
123       SÎ³: <Vector -3.22, -19.69, 0.18>
124       Cprev <Vector -0.73, -17.44, -2.01>
125       Nnext: <Vector 1.92, -19.18, -0.63>
126    <BLANKLINE>
127     Proximal Internal Coords:
128       N: <Vector -0.41, 1.40, -0.00>
129       CÎ±: <Vector 0.00, 0.00, 0.00>
130       C: <Vector 1.50, 0.00, 0.00>
131       O: <Vector 2.12, 0.71, -0.80>
132       CÎ²: <Vector -0.50, -0.70, -1.25>
133       SÎ³: <Vector 0.04, -2.41, -1.50>
134       Cprev <Vector -2.67, -21.75, 5.36>
135       Nnext: <Vector -0.02, -18.76, 3.36>
136    Distal Internal Coords:
137       N: <Vector 1.04, -5.63, 1.17>
138       CÎ±: <Vector 1.04, -4.18, 1.31>
139       C: <Vector 1.72, -3.68, 2.57>
140       O: <Vector 1.57, -2.51, 2.92>
141       CÎ²: <Vector -0.41, -3.66, 1.24>
142       SÎ³: <Vector -1.14, -3.69, -0.43>
143       Cprev <Vector -0.73, -17.44, -2.01>
144       Nnext: <Vector 1.92, -19.18, -0.63>
145     Conformation: (Î§1-Î§5):  174.629Â°, 82.518Â°, -83.322Â°, -62.524Â° -73.827Â°  Energy: 1.696 kcal/mol
146     CÎ± Distance: 4.502 Ã 
147     Torsion length: 231.531 deg 
148    >
149
150    Get a list of disulfides via slicing
151    >>> subset = DisulfideList(PDB_SS[0:10],'subset')
152    >>> subset.display_overlay()        # display all disulfides overlaid in stick style
153    '''
154    
155    def __init__(self, iterable, id: str):
156        '''
157        Initialize a DisulfideList object.
158
159        Parameters
160        ----------
161        iterable : iterable
162            Must be a valid iterable like []
163        id : str
164            Name of the list.        
165        '''
166
167        self.pdb_id = id
168        super().__init__(self.validate_ss(item) for item in iterable)
169
170    def __getitem__(self, item):
171        if isinstance(item, slice):
172            indices = range(*item.indices(len(self.data)))
173            name = self.data[0].pdb_id
174            sublist = [self.data[i] for i in indices]
175            return DisulfideList(sublist, name)    
176        return UserList.__getitem__(self, item)
177    
178    def __setitem__(self, index, item):
179        self.data[index] = self.validate_ss(item)
180
181    def insert(self, index, item):
182        '''
183        Insert a Disulfide into the list at the specified index
184
185        Parameters
186        ----------
187        index : int
188            Index insertion point
189        item : Disulfide
190            Disulfide to insert
191        '''
192        self.data.insert(index, self.validate_ss(item))
193
194    def append(self, item):
195        '''
196        Append a Disulfide at the end of the list.
197
198        Parameters
199        ----------
200        index : int
201            Index insertion point
202        item : Disulfide
203            Disulfide to insert
204        '''
205        self.data.append(self.validate_ss(item))
206
207    def extend(self, other):
208        if isinstance(other, type(self)):
209            self.data.extend(other)
210        else:
211            self.data.extend(self._validate_ss(item) for item in other)
212    
213    def validate_ss(self, value):
214        if isinstance(value, type(self)):
215            return value
216        raise TypeError(f"Disulfide object expected, got {type(value).__name__}")
217
218    def Ovalidate_ss(self, value):
219        return value
220    
221    def pprint(self):
222        '''
223        Pretty print self.
224        '''
225        sslist = self.data
226        for ss in sslist:
227            ss.pprint()
228    
229    def pprint_all(self):
230        '''
231        Pretty print full disulfide descriptions in self.
232        '''
233        sslist = self.data
234        for ss in sslist:
235            ss.pprint_all()
236    
237    @property
238    def id(self):
239        '''
240        PDB ID of the list
241        '''
242        return(self.pdb_id)
243    
244    @id.setter
245    def id(self, value):
246        '''
247        Set the DisulfideList ID
248
249        Parameters
250        ----------
251        value : str
252            List ID
253        '''
254        self.pdb_id = value
255    
256    def get_by_name(self, name):
257        '''
258        Returns the Disulfide with the given name from the list.
259        '''
260        sslist = self.data
261        res = None
262
263        for ss in sslist:
264            id = ss.name
265            if id == name:
266                res = ss.copy()
267                break
268        return res
269
270    def minmax_energy(self):
271        '''
272        Return the Disulfides with the minimum and maximum energies
273        from the DisulfideList.
274
275        Returns
276        -------
277        Disulfide
278            Disulfide with the given ID
279        '''
280        sslist = sorted(self.data)
281        return sslist[0], sslist[-1]
282
283    def min(self):
284        '''
285        Return Disulfide from the list with the minimum energy
286
287        Returns
288        -------
289        Disulfide
290            Disulfide with the minimum energy.
291        '''
292        sslist = sorted(self.data)
293        return sslist[0]
294    
295    def max(self):
296        '''
297        Return Disulfide from the list with the maximum energy
298
299        Returns
300        -------
301        Disulfide
302            Disulfide with the maximum energy.
303        '''
304        sslist = sorted(self.data)
305        return sslist[-1]
306    
307    def get_chains(self):
308        '''
309        Return the chain IDs for chains within the given Disulfide.
310        '''
311        res_dict = {'xxx'}
312        sslist = self.data
313
314        for ss in sslist:
315            pchain = ss.proximal_chain
316            dchain = ss.distal_chain
317            res_dict.update(pchain)
318            res_dict.update(dchain)
319        
320        res_dict.remove('xxx')
321
322        return res_dict
323
324    def has_chain(self, chain) -> bool:
325        '''
326        Returns True if given chain contained in Disulfide, False otherwise.
327        '''
328        
329        chns = {'xxx'}
330        chns = self.get_chains()
331        if chain in chns:
332            return True
333        else:
334            return False
335
336    def by_chain(self, chain: str):
337        '''
338        Return a DisulfideList from the input chain identifier.
339
340        Arguments:
341            chain: str - chain identifier, 'A', 'B, etc
342        Returns:
343            DisulfideList containing disulfides within that chain.
344        '''
345        
346        reslist = DisulfideList([], chain)
347        sslist = self.data
348
349        for ss in sslist:
350            pchain = ss.proximal_chain
351            dchain = ss.distal_chain
352            if pchain == dchain:
353                if pchain == chain:
354                    reslist.append(ss)
355            else:
356                print(f'Cross chain SS: {ss.repr_compact}:')
357        return reslist
358    
359    @property
360    def torsion_df(self):
361        return self.build_torsion_df()
362    
363    def build_torsion_df(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
364        '''
365        Create a dataframe containing the input DisulfideList torsional parameters,
366        ca-ca distance, energy, and phi-psi angles. This can take a while for the
367        entire database.
368
369        :param SSList: DisulfideList - input list of Disulfides
370        :return: pandas.Dataframe containing the torsions
371        '''
372        # create a dataframe with the following columns for the disulfide 
373        # conformations extracted from the structure
374        
375        SS_df = pd.DataFrame(columns=Torsion_DF_Cols)
376        sslist = self.data
377
378        pbar = tqdm(sslist, ncols=_PBAR_COLS)
379        for ss in pbar:
380            new_row = [ss.pdb_id, ss.name, ss.proximal, ss.distal, ss.chi1, ss.chi2, 
381                    ss.chi3, ss.chi4, ss.chi5, ss.energy, ss.ca_distance,
382                    ss.psiprox, ss.psiprox, ss.phidist, ss.psidist, ss.torsion_distance]
383            # add the row to the end of the dataframe
384            SS_df.loc[len(SS_df.index)] = new_row
385        
386        return SS_df
387
388    @property
389    def distance_df(self):
390        return self.build_distance_df()
391    
392    def build_distance_df(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
393        """
394        Create a dataframe containing the input DisulfideList ca-ca distance, energy. 
395        This can take several minutes for the entire database.
396
397        :return: DataFrame containing Ca distances
398        :rtype: pd.DataFrame
399        """
400        
401        # create a dataframe with the following columns for the disulfide 
402        # conformations extracted from the structure
403        
404        SS_df = pd.DataFrame(columns=Distance_DF_Cols)
405        sslist = self.data
406
407        pbar = tqdm(sslist, ncols=_PBAR_COLS)
408        for ss in pbar:
409            new_row = [ss.pdb_id, ss.name, ss.proximal, ss.distal, ss.energy, ss.ca_distance]
410            # add the row to the end of the dataframe
411            SS_df.loc[len(SS_df.index)] = new_row
412        
413        return SS_df
414
415    def minmax_distance(self):
416        """
417        """
418        distance_df = self.build_distance_df()
419        distance_df.sort_values(by=['ca_distance'], ascending=True, inplace=True)
420        ssmin_id = distance_df.iloc[0]['ss_id']
421        ssmax_id = distance_df.iloc[-1]['ss_id']
422
423        ssmin = self.get_by_name(ssmin_id)
424        ssmax = self.get_by_name(ssmax_id)
425
426        return ssmin, ssmax
427
428    @property
429    def torsion_array(self):
430        return(self.get_torsion_array())
431    
432    def get_torsion_array(self):
433        """
434        Returns an rows X 5 array representing the dihedral angles
435        in the given disulfide list.
436
437        """
438        sslist = self.data
439        tot = len(sslist)
440        res = numpy.zeros(shape=(tot, 5))
441
442        for idx, ss in zip(range(tot), sslist):
443            row = ss.torsion_array
444            res[idx] = row
445        return res
446
447    def Torsion_RMS(self):
448        '''
449        Calculate the RMS distance in torsion space between all pairs in the
450        DisulfideList
451        '''
452        sslist = self.data
453        tot = len(sslist)
454
455        totsq = 0.0
456        for ss1 in sslist:
457            tors1 = ss1.torsion_array
458            total1 = 0
459            for ss2 in sslist:
460                tors2 = ss2.torsion_array
461                total1 += proteusPy.dist_squared(tors1, tors2)
462        
463            totsq = totsq + (total1 / tot)
464
465        return(math.sqrt(totsq/tot**2))
466
467    # Rendering engine calculates and instantiates all bond 
468    # cylinders and atomic sphere meshes. Called by all high level routines
469
470    def _render(self, style) -> pv.Plotter:
471        ''' 
472            Display a window showing the list of disulfides in the given style.
473            Argument:
474                self
475                style: one of 'cpk', 'bs', 'sb', 'plain', 'cov', 'pd'
476            Returns:
477                Window displaying the Disulfides.
478        '''
479        
480        ssList = self.data
481        tot_ss = len(ssList) # number off ssbonds
482        rows, cols = grid_dimensions(tot_ss)
483        winsize = (512 * cols, 512 * rows)
484
485        pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=winsize, shape=(rows, cols))
486
487        i = 0
488
489        for r in range(rows):
490            for c in range(cols):
491                pl.subplot(r,c)
492                if i < tot_ss:
493                    ss = ssList[i]
494                    src = ss.pdb_id
495                    enrg = ss.energy
496                    title = f'{src}: {ss.proximal}{ss.proximal_chain}-{ss.distal}{ss.distal_chain}: {enrg:.2f} kcal/mol Ca: {ss.ca_distance:.2f}'
497                    pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
498                    ss._render(pl, style=style, bondcolor=BOND_COLOR, bs_scale=BS_SCALE, 
499                            spec=SPECULARITY, specpow=SPEC_POWER)
500                i += 1
501        return pl
502
503    def display(self, style='sb'):
504        pl = pv.Plotter()
505
506        pl = self._render(style)
507        pl.add_camera_orientation_widget()
508        pl.enable_anti_aliasing('msaa')
509        pl.link_views()
510        pl.reset_camera()
511        pl.show()
512        
513    def screenshot(self, style='bs', fname='sslist.png', verbose=True):
514        ''' 
515            Save the interactive window displaying the list of disulfides in the given style.
516            Argument:
517                self
518                style: one of 'cpk', 'bs', 'sb', 'plain', 'cov', 'pd'
519                fname: filename for the resulting image file.
520            Returns:
521                Image file saved to disk.
522        '''
523
524        pl = pv.Plotter()
525        pl = self._render(style=style)
526
527        pl.enable_anti_aliasing('msaa')
528        pl.link_views()
529        pl.reset_camera()
530        pl.show(auto_close=False)
531
532        if verbose:
533            print(f'Saving file: {fname}')
534        
535        pl.screenshot(fname)
536        
537        if verbose:
538            print(f'Saved file: {fname}')
539        
540        return
541    
542    def display_overlay(self, screenshot=False, movie=False, 
543                        verbose=True,
544                        fname='ss_overlay.png'):
545        ''' 
546        Display all disulfides in the list overlaid in stick mode against
547        a common coordinate frames. This allows us to see all of the disulfides
548        at one time in a single view. Colors vary smoothy between bonds.
549        
550        Arguments:
551            PDB_SS: DisulfideLoader object initialized with the database.
552            pdbid: the actual PDB id string
553
554        Returns: None.    
555        ''' 
556        id = self.pdb_id
557        ssbonds = self.data
558        tot_ss = len(ssbonds) # number off ssbonds
559
560        tot_ss = len(ssbonds) # number off ssbonds
561        title = f'Disulfides for SS list {id}: ({tot_ss} total)'
562
563        if movie:
564            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=WINSIZE, off_screen=True)
565        else:
566            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=WINSIZE, off_screen=False)
567
568        pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
569        pl.enable_anti_aliasing('msaa')
570        pl.add_axes()
571
572        mycol = numpy.zeros(shape=(tot_ss, 3))
573        mycol = proteusPy.cmap_vector(tot_ss)
574
575        for i, ss in zip(range(tot_ss), ssbonds):
576            color = [int(mycol[i][0]), int(mycol[i][1]), int(mycol[i][2])]
577            ss._render(pl, style='plain', bondcolor=color, translate=False)
578
579        pl.reset_camera()
580
581        if screenshot:
582            pl.show(auto_close=False) # allows for manipulation
583            pl.screenshot(fname)
584        elif movie:
585            if verbose:
586                print(f'Saving mp4 animation to: {fname}')
587                
588            pl.open_movie(fname, quality=9)
589            path = pl.generate_orbital_path(n_points=360)
590            pl.orbit_on_path(path, write_frames=True)
591            pl.close()
592
593            if verbose:
594                print(f'Saved mp4 animation to: {fname}')
595        else:
596            pl.show()
597        
598        return
599
600if __name__ == "__main__":
601    import doctest
602    doctest.testmod()

def atest(): 
23def atest():
24    '''
25    Calculate rows and columns for the given needed to display
26    a given number of disulfides in a square aspect.
27
28    :param n: int Number of Disulfides
29    :param y: int Number of Disulfides
30    :return: int rows, columns
31    '''
32    return

Calculate rows and columns for the given needed to display a given number of disulfides in a square aspect.

Parameters
  • n: int Number of Disulfides
  • y: int Number of Disulfides
Returns

int rows, columns

def grid_dimensions(n): 
34def grid_dimensions(n):
35    '''
36    Calculate rows and columns for the given needed to display
37    a given number of disulfides in a square aspect.
38
39    Parameters
40    ----------
41    n : int
42        Number of Disulfides
43    y : float
44        Number of bosons
45
46    Returns
47    -------
48    int
49        rows, columns
50    '''
51    
52    root = math.sqrt(n)
53    # If the square root is a whole number, return that as the number of rows and columns
54    if root == int(root):
55        return int(root), int(root)
56    # If the square root is not a whole number, round up and return that as the number of columns
57    # and calculate the number of rows as the number of images divided by the number of columns
58    else:
59        columns = math.ceil(root)
60        return int(n / columns), int(columns)

Calculate rows and columns for the given needed to display a given number of disulfides in a square aspect.

Parameters

n : int Number of Disulfides y : float Number of bosons

Returns

int rows, columns

class DisulfideList(collections.UserList): 
 68class DisulfideList(UserList):
 69    '''
 70    Class provides a sortable list for Disulfide objects.
 71    Indexing and slicing are supported, and normal list operations like 
 72    .insert, .append and .extend. The DisulfideList object must be initialized 
 73    with an iterable (tuple, list) and a name.
 74    
 75    The class can also render Disulfides to a pyVista window using the 
 76    DisulfideList.display() method. See below for examples.\n
 77
 78    Examples:
 79    >>> from proteusPy.Disulfide import Disulfide 
 80    >>> from proteusPy.DisulfideLoader import DisulfideLoader
 81    >>> from proteusPy.DisulfideList import DisulfideList
 82        
 83    Instantiate some variables. Note: the list is initialized with an iterable and a name (optional)
 84
 85    >>> SS = Disulfide('tmp')
 86    >>> SSlist = DisulfideList([],'ss')
 87
 88    >>> PDB_SS = DisulfideLoader(verbose=False, subset=True)  # load the Disulfide database
 89    >>> SS = PDB_SS[0]              # returns a Disulfide object at index 0
 90    >>> SS
 91    <Disulfide 4yys_22A_65A SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 22 A Distal: 65 A>
 92    >>> SS4yys = PDB_SS['4yys']     # returns a DisulfideList containing all
 93    >>> SS4yys
 94    [<Disulfide 4yys_22A_65A SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 22 A Distal: 65 A>, <Disulfide 4yys_56A_98A SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 56 A Distal: 98 A>, <Disulfide 4yys_156A_207A SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 156 A Distal: 207 A>, <Disulfide 4yys_22B_65B SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 22 B Distal: 65 B>, <Disulfide 4yys_56B_98B SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 56 B Distal: 98 B>, <Disulfide 4yys_156B_207B SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 156 B Distal: 207 B>]
 95
 96    Make some empty disulfides
 97    >>> ss1 = Disulfide('ss1')
 98    >>> ss2 = Disulfide('ss2')
 99
100    Make a DisulfideList containing ss1, named 'tmp'
101    >>> sslist = DisulfideList([ss1], 'tmp')
102    >>> sslist.append(ss2)
103
104    Extract the first disulfide
105    >>> ss1 = PDB_SS[0]
106    >>> ss1.pprint_all()
107    <Disulfide 4yys_22A_65A SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 22 A Distal: 65 A
108     Proximal Chain fullID: <('4yys', 0, 'A', (' ', 22, ' '))> Distal Chain fullID: <('4yys', 0, 'A', (' ', 65, ' '))> 
109    Proximal Coordinates:
110       N: <Vector -2.36, -20.48, 5.21>
111       CÎ±: <Vector -2.10, -19.89, 3.90>
112       C: <Vector -1.12, -18.78, 4.12>
113       O: <Vector -1.30, -17.96, 5.03>
114       CÎ²: <Vector -3.38, -19.31, 3.32>
115       SÎ³: <Vector -3.24, -18.40, 1.76>
116       Cprev <Vector -2.67, -21.75, 5.36>
117       Nnext: <Vector -0.02, -18.76, 3.36>
118     Distal Coordinates:
119       N: <Vector -0.60, -18.71, -1.62>
120       CÎ±: <Vector -0.48, -19.10, -0.22>
121       C: <Vector 0.92, -19.52, 0.18>
122       O: <Vector 1.10, -20.09, 1.25>
123       CÎ²: <Vector -1.48, -20.23, 0.08>
124       SÎ³: <Vector -3.22, -19.69, 0.18>
125       Cprev <Vector -0.73, -17.44, -2.01>
126       Nnext: <Vector 1.92, -19.18, -0.63>
127    <BLANKLINE>
128     Proximal Internal Coords:
129       N: <Vector -0.41, 1.40, -0.00>
130       CÎ±: <Vector 0.00, 0.00, 0.00>
131       C: <Vector 1.50, 0.00, 0.00>
132       O: <Vector 2.12, 0.71, -0.80>
133       CÎ²: <Vector -0.50, -0.70, -1.25>
134       SÎ³: <Vector 0.04, -2.41, -1.50>
135       Cprev <Vector -2.67, -21.75, 5.36>
136       Nnext: <Vector -0.02, -18.76, 3.36>
137    Distal Internal Coords:
138       N: <Vector 1.04, -5.63, 1.17>
139       CÎ±: <Vector 1.04, -4.18, 1.31>
140       C: <Vector 1.72, -3.68, 2.57>
141       O: <Vector 1.57, -2.51, 2.92>
142       CÎ²: <Vector -0.41, -3.66, 1.24>
143       SÎ³: <Vector -1.14, -3.69, -0.43>
144       Cprev <Vector -0.73, -17.44, -2.01>
145       Nnext: <Vector 1.92, -19.18, -0.63>
146     Conformation: (Î§1-Î§5):  174.629Â°, 82.518Â°, -83.322Â°, -62.524Â° -73.827Â°  Energy: 1.696 kcal/mol
147     CÎ± Distance: 4.502 Ã 
148     Torsion length: 231.531 deg 
149    >
150
151    Get a list of disulfides via slicing
152    >>> subset = DisulfideList(PDB_SS[0:10],'subset')
153    >>> subset.display_overlay()        # display all disulfides overlaid in stick style
154    '''
155    
156    def __init__(self, iterable, id: str):
157        '''
158        Initialize a DisulfideList object.
159
160        Parameters
161        ----------
162        iterable : iterable
163            Must be a valid iterable like []
164        id : str
165            Name of the list.        
166        '''
167
168        self.pdb_id = id
169        super().__init__(self.validate_ss(item) for item in iterable)
170
171    def __getitem__(self, item):
172        if isinstance(item, slice):
173            indices = range(*item.indices(len(self.data)))
174            name = self.data[0].pdb_id
175            sublist = [self.data[i] for i in indices]
176            return DisulfideList(sublist, name)    
177        return UserList.__getitem__(self, item)
178    
179    def __setitem__(self, index, item):
180        self.data[index] = self.validate_ss(item)
181
182    def insert(self, index, item):
183        '''
184        Insert a Disulfide into the list at the specified index
185
186        Parameters
187        ----------
188        index : int
189            Index insertion point
190        item : Disulfide
191            Disulfide to insert
192        '''
193        self.data.insert(index, self.validate_ss(item))
194
195    def append(self, item):
196        '''
197        Append a Disulfide at the end of the list.
198
199        Parameters
200        ----------
201        index : int
202            Index insertion point
203        item : Disulfide
204            Disulfide to insert
205        '''
206        self.data.append(self.validate_ss(item))
207
208    def extend(self, other):
209        if isinstance(other, type(self)):
210            self.data.extend(other)
211        else:
212            self.data.extend(self._validate_ss(item) for item in other)
213    
214    def validate_ss(self, value):
215        if isinstance(value, type(self)):
216            return value
217        raise TypeError(f"Disulfide object expected, got {type(value).__name__}")
218
219    def Ovalidate_ss(self, value):
220        return value
221    
222    def pprint(self):
223        '''
224        Pretty print self.
225        '''
226        sslist = self.data
227        for ss in sslist:
228            ss.pprint()
229    
230    def pprint_all(self):
231        '''
232        Pretty print full disulfide descriptions in self.
233        '''
234        sslist = self.data
235        for ss in sslist:
236            ss.pprint_all()
237    
238    @property
239    def id(self):
240        '''
241        PDB ID of the list
242        '''
243        return(self.pdb_id)
244    
245    @id.setter
246    def id(self, value):
247        '''
248        Set the DisulfideList ID
249
250        Parameters
251        ----------
252        value : str
253            List ID
254        '''
255        self.pdb_id = value
256    
257    def get_by_name(self, name):
258        '''
259        Returns the Disulfide with the given name from the list.
260        '''
261        sslist = self.data
262        res = None
263
264        for ss in sslist:
265            id = ss.name
266            if id == name:
267                res = ss.copy()
268                break
269        return res
270
271    def minmax_energy(self):
272        '''
273        Return the Disulfides with the minimum and maximum energies
274        from the DisulfideList.
275
276        Returns
277        -------
278        Disulfide
279            Disulfide with the given ID
280        '''
281        sslist = sorted(self.data)
282        return sslist[0], sslist[-1]
283
284    def min(self):
285        '''
286        Return Disulfide from the list with the minimum energy
287
288        Returns
289        -------
290        Disulfide
291            Disulfide with the minimum energy.
292        '''
293        sslist = sorted(self.data)
294        return sslist[0]
295    
296    def max(self):
297        '''
298        Return Disulfide from the list with the maximum energy
299
300        Returns
301        -------
302        Disulfide
303            Disulfide with the maximum energy.
304        '''
305        sslist = sorted(self.data)
306        return sslist[-1]
307    
308    def get_chains(self):
309        '''
310        Return the chain IDs for chains within the given Disulfide.
311        '''
312        res_dict = {'xxx'}
313        sslist = self.data
314
315        for ss in sslist:
316            pchain = ss.proximal_chain
317            dchain = ss.distal_chain
318            res_dict.update(pchain)
319            res_dict.update(dchain)
320        
321        res_dict.remove('xxx')
322
323        return res_dict
324
325    def has_chain(self, chain) -> bool:
326        '''
327        Returns True if given chain contained in Disulfide, False otherwise.
328        '''
329        
330        chns = {'xxx'}
331        chns = self.get_chains()
332        if chain in chns:
333            return True
334        else:
335            return False
336
337    def by_chain(self, chain: str):
338        '''
339        Return a DisulfideList from the input chain identifier.
340
341        Arguments:
342            chain: str - chain identifier, 'A', 'B, etc
343        Returns:
344            DisulfideList containing disulfides within that chain.
345        '''
346        
347        reslist = DisulfideList([], chain)
348        sslist = self.data
349
350        for ss in sslist:
351            pchain = ss.proximal_chain
352            dchain = ss.distal_chain
353            if pchain == dchain:
354                if pchain == chain:
355                    reslist.append(ss)
356            else:
357                print(f'Cross chain SS: {ss.repr_compact}:')
358        return reslist
359    
360    @property
361    def torsion_df(self):
362        return self.build_torsion_df()
363    
364    def build_torsion_df(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
365        '''
366        Create a dataframe containing the input DisulfideList torsional parameters,
367        ca-ca distance, energy, and phi-psi angles. This can take a while for the
368        entire database.
369
370        :param SSList: DisulfideList - input list of Disulfides
371        :return: pandas.Dataframe containing the torsions
372        '''
373        # create a dataframe with the following columns for the disulfide 
374        # conformations extracted from the structure
375        
376        SS_df = pd.DataFrame(columns=Torsion_DF_Cols)
377        sslist = self.data
378
379        pbar = tqdm(sslist, ncols=_PBAR_COLS)
380        for ss in pbar:
381            new_row = [ss.pdb_id, ss.name, ss.proximal, ss.distal, ss.chi1, ss.chi2, 
382                    ss.chi3, ss.chi4, ss.chi5, ss.energy, ss.ca_distance,
383                    ss.psiprox, ss.psiprox, ss.phidist, ss.psidist, ss.torsion_distance]
384            # add the row to the end of the dataframe
385            SS_df.loc[len(SS_df.index)] = new_row
386        
387        return SS_df
388
389    @property
390    def distance_df(self):
391        return self.build_distance_df()
392    
393    def build_distance_df(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
394        """
395        Create a dataframe containing the input DisulfideList ca-ca distance, energy. 
396        This can take several minutes for the entire database.
397
398        :return: DataFrame containing Ca distances
399        :rtype: pd.DataFrame
400        """
401        
402        # create a dataframe with the following columns for the disulfide 
403        # conformations extracted from the structure
404        
405        SS_df = pd.DataFrame(columns=Distance_DF_Cols)
406        sslist = self.data
407
408        pbar = tqdm(sslist, ncols=_PBAR_COLS)
409        for ss in pbar:
410            new_row = [ss.pdb_id, ss.name, ss.proximal, ss.distal, ss.energy, ss.ca_distance]
411            # add the row to the end of the dataframe
412            SS_df.loc[len(SS_df.index)] = new_row
413        
414        return SS_df
415
416    def minmax_distance(self):
417        """
418        """
419        distance_df = self.build_distance_df()
420        distance_df.sort_values(by=['ca_distance'], ascending=True, inplace=True)
421        ssmin_id = distance_df.iloc[0]['ss_id']
422        ssmax_id = distance_df.iloc[-1]['ss_id']
423
424        ssmin = self.get_by_name(ssmin_id)
425        ssmax = self.get_by_name(ssmax_id)
426
427        return ssmin, ssmax
428
429    @property
430    def torsion_array(self):
431        return(self.get_torsion_array())
432    
433    def get_torsion_array(self):
434        """
435        Returns an rows X 5 array representing the dihedral angles
436        in the given disulfide list.
437
438        """
439        sslist = self.data
440        tot = len(sslist)
441        res = numpy.zeros(shape=(tot, 5))
442
443        for idx, ss in zip(range(tot), sslist):
444            row = ss.torsion_array
445            res[idx] = row
446        return res
447
448    def Torsion_RMS(self):
449        '''
450        Calculate the RMS distance in torsion space between all pairs in the
451        DisulfideList
452        '''
453        sslist = self.data
454        tot = len(sslist)
455
456        totsq = 0.0
457        for ss1 in sslist:
458            tors1 = ss1.torsion_array
459            total1 = 0
460            for ss2 in sslist:
461                tors2 = ss2.torsion_array
462                total1 += proteusPy.dist_squared(tors1, tors2)
463        
464            totsq = totsq + (total1 / tot)
465
466        return(math.sqrt(totsq/tot**2))
467
468    # Rendering engine calculates and instantiates all bond 
469    # cylinders and atomic sphere meshes. Called by all high level routines
470
471    def _render(self, style) -> pv.Plotter:
472        ''' 
473            Display a window showing the list of disulfides in the given style.
474            Argument:
475                self
476                style: one of 'cpk', 'bs', 'sb', 'plain', 'cov', 'pd'
477            Returns:
478                Window displaying the Disulfides.
479        '''
480        
481        ssList = self.data
482        tot_ss = len(ssList) # number off ssbonds
483        rows, cols = grid_dimensions(tot_ss)
484        winsize = (512 * cols, 512 * rows)
485
486        pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=winsize, shape=(rows, cols))
487
488        i = 0
489
490        for r in range(rows):
491            for c in range(cols):
492                pl.subplot(r,c)
493                if i < tot_ss:
494                    ss = ssList[i]
495                    src = ss.pdb_id
496                    enrg = ss.energy
497                    title = f'{src}: {ss.proximal}{ss.proximal_chain}-{ss.distal}{ss.distal_chain}: {enrg:.2f} kcal/mol Ca: {ss.ca_distance:.2f}'
498                    pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
499                    ss._render(pl, style=style, bondcolor=BOND_COLOR, bs_scale=BS_SCALE, 
500                            spec=SPECULARITY, specpow=SPEC_POWER)
501                i += 1
502        return pl
503
504    def display(self, style='sb'):
505        pl = pv.Plotter()
506
507        pl = self._render(style)
508        pl.add_camera_orientation_widget()
509        pl.enable_anti_aliasing('msaa')
510        pl.link_views()
511        pl.reset_camera()
512        pl.show()
513        
514    def screenshot(self, style='bs', fname='sslist.png', verbose=True):
515        ''' 
516            Save the interactive window displaying the list of disulfides in the given style.
517            Argument:
518                self
519                style: one of 'cpk', 'bs', 'sb', 'plain', 'cov', 'pd'
520                fname: filename for the resulting image file.
521            Returns:
522                Image file saved to disk.
523        '''
524
525        pl = pv.Plotter()
526        pl = self._render(style=style)
527
528        pl.enable_anti_aliasing('msaa')
529        pl.link_views()
530        pl.reset_camera()
531        pl.show(auto_close=False)
532
533        if verbose:
534            print(f'Saving file: {fname}')
535        
536        pl.screenshot(fname)
537        
538        if verbose:
539            print(f'Saved file: {fname}')
540        
541        return
542    
543    def display_overlay(self, screenshot=False, movie=False, 
544                        verbose=True,
545                        fname='ss_overlay.png'):
546        ''' 
547        Display all disulfides in the list overlaid in stick mode against
548        a common coordinate frames. This allows us to see all of the disulfides
549        at one time in a single view. Colors vary smoothy between bonds.
550        
551        Arguments:
552            PDB_SS: DisulfideLoader object initialized with the database.
553            pdbid: the actual PDB id string
554
555        Returns: None.    
556        ''' 
557        id = self.pdb_id
558        ssbonds = self.data
559        tot_ss = len(ssbonds) # number off ssbonds
560
561        tot_ss = len(ssbonds) # number off ssbonds
562        title = f'Disulfides for SS list {id}: ({tot_ss} total)'
563
564        if movie:
565            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=WINSIZE, off_screen=True)
566        else:
567            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=WINSIZE, off_screen=False)
568
569        pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
570        pl.enable_anti_aliasing('msaa')
571        pl.add_axes()
572
573        mycol = numpy.zeros(shape=(tot_ss, 3))
574        mycol = proteusPy.cmap_vector(tot_ss)
575
576        for i, ss in zip(range(tot_ss), ssbonds):
577            color = [int(mycol[i][0]), int(mycol[i][1]), int(mycol[i][2])]
578            ss._render(pl, style='plain', bondcolor=color, translate=False)
579
580        pl.reset_camera()
581
582        if screenshot:
583            pl.show(auto_close=False) # allows for manipulation
584            pl.screenshot(fname)
585        elif movie:
586            if verbose:
587                print(f'Saving mp4 animation to: {fname}')
588                
589            pl.open_movie(fname, quality=9)
590            path = pl.generate_orbital_path(n_points=360)
591            pl.orbit_on_path(path, write_frames=True)
592            pl.close()
593
594            if verbose:
595                print(f'Saved mp4 animation to: {fname}')
596        else:
597            pl.show()
598        
599        return

Class provides a sortable list for Disulfide objects. Indexing and slicing are supported, and normal list operations like .insert, .append and .extend. The DisulfideList object must be initialized with an iterable (tuple, list) and a name.

The class can also render Disulfides to a pyVista window using the DisulfideList.display() method. See below for examples.

Examples:

>>> from proteusPy.Disulfide import Disulfide 
>>> from proteusPy.DisulfideLoader import DisulfideLoader
>>> from proteusPy.DisulfideList import DisulfideList

Instantiate some variables. Note: the list is initialized with an iterable and a name (optional)

>>> SS = Disulfide('tmp')
>>> SSlist = DisulfideList([],'ss')

>>> PDB_SS = DisulfideLoader(verbose=False, subset=True)  # load the Disulfide database
>>> SS = PDB_SS[0]              # returns a Disulfide object at index 0
>>> SS
<Disulfide 4yys_22A_65A SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 22 A Distal: 65 A>
>>> SS4yys = PDB_SS['4yys']     # returns a DisulfideList containing all
>>> SS4yys
[<Disulfide 4yys_22A_65A SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 22 A Distal: 65 A>, <Disulfide 4yys_56A_98A SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 56 A Distal: 98 A>, <Disulfide 4yys_156A_207A SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 156 A Distal: 207 A>, <Disulfide 4yys_22B_65B SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 22 B Distal: 65 B>, <Disulfide 4yys_56B_98B SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 56 B Distal: 98 B>, <Disulfide 4yys_156B_207B SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 156 B Distal: 207 B>]

Make some empty disulfides

>>> ss1 = Disulfide('ss1')
>>> ss2 = Disulfide('ss2')

Make a DisulfideList containing ss1, named 'tmp'

>>> sslist = DisulfideList([ss1], 'tmp')
>>> sslist.append(ss2)

Extract the first disulfide

>>> ss1 = PDB_SS[0]
>>> ss1.pprint_all()
<Disulfide 4yys_22A_65A SourceID: 4yys Proximal: 22 A Distal: 65 A
 Proximal Chain fullID: <('4yys', 0, 'A', (' ', 22, ' '))> Distal Chain fullID: <('4yys', 0, 'A', (' ', 65, ' '))> 
Proximal Coordinates:
   N: <Vector -2.36, -20.48, 5.21>
   CÎ±: <Vector -2.10, -19.89, 3.90>
   C: <Vector -1.12, -18.78, 4.12>
   O: <Vector -1.30, -17.96, 5.03>
   CÎ²: <Vector -3.38, -19.31, 3.32>
   SÎ³: <Vector -3.24, -18.40, 1.76>
   Cprev <Vector -2.67, -21.75, 5.36>
   Nnext: <Vector -0.02, -18.76, 3.36>
 Distal Coordinates:
   N: <Vector -0.60, -18.71, -1.62>
   CÎ±: <Vector -0.48, -19.10, -0.22>
   C: <Vector 0.92, -19.52, 0.18>
   O: <Vector 1.10, -20.09, 1.25>
   CÎ²: <Vector -1.48, -20.23, 0.08>
   SÎ³: <Vector -3.22, -19.69, 0.18>
   Cprev <Vector -0.73, -17.44, -2.01>
   Nnext: <Vector 1.92, -19.18, -0.63>
<BLANKLINE>
 Proximal Internal Coords:
   N: <Vector -0.41, 1.40, -0.00>
   CÎ±: <Vector 0.00, 0.00, 0.00>
   C: <Vector 1.50, 0.00, 0.00>
   O: <Vector 2.12, 0.71, -0.80>
   CÎ²: <Vector -0.50, -0.70, -1.25>
   SÎ³: <Vector 0.04, -2.41, -1.50>
   Cprev <Vector -2.67, -21.75, 5.36>
   Nnext: <Vector -0.02, -18.76, 3.36>
Distal Internal Coords:
   N: <Vector 1.04, -5.63, 1.17>
   CÎ±: <Vector 1.04, -4.18, 1.31>
   C: <Vector 1.72, -3.68, 2.57>
   O: <Vector 1.57, -2.51, 2.92>
   CÎ²: <Vector -0.41, -3.66, 1.24>
   SÎ³: <Vector -1.14, -3.69, -0.43>
   Cprev <Vector -0.73, -17.44, -2.01>
   Nnext: <Vector 1.92, -19.18, -0.63>
 Conformation: (Î§1-Î§5):  174.629Â°, 82.518Â°, -83.322Â°, -62.524Â° -73.827Â°  Energy: 1.696 kcal/mol
 CÎ± Distance: 4.502 Ã 
 Torsion length: 231.531 deg 
>

Get a list of disulfides via slicing

>>> subset = DisulfideList(PDB_SS[0:10],'subset')
>>> subset.display_overlay()        # display all disulfides overlaid in stick style

164        id : str

def extend(self, other): 
208    def extend(self, other):
209        if isinstance(other, type(self)):
210            self.data.extend(other)
211        else:
212            self.data.extend(self._validate_ss(item) for item in other)

S.extend(iterable) -- extend sequence by appending elements from the iterable

def validate_ss(self, value): 
214    def validate_ss(self, value):
215        if isinstance(value, type(self)):
216            return value
217        raise TypeError(f"Disulfide object expected, got {type(value).__name__}")

def get_by_name(self, name): 
257    def get_by_name(self, name):
258        '''
259        Returns the Disulfide with the given name from the list.
260        '''
261        sslist = self.data
262        res = None
263
264        for ss in sslist:
265            id = ss.name
266            if id == name:
267                res = ss.copy()
268                break
269        return res

Returns the Disulfide with the given name from the list.

def get_chains(self): 
308    def get_chains(self):
309        '''
310        Return the chain IDs for chains within the given Disulfide.
311        '''
312        res_dict = {'xxx'}
313        sslist = self.data
314
315        for ss in sslist:
316            pchain = ss.proximal_chain
317            dchain = ss.distal_chain
318            res_dict.update(pchain)
319            res_dict.update(dchain)
320        
321        res_dict.remove('xxx')
322
323        return res_dict

def has_chain(self, chain) -> bool:

def by_chain(self, chain: str): 
337    def by_chain(self, chain: str):
338        '''
339        Return a DisulfideList from the input chain identifier.
340
341        Arguments:
342            chain: str - chain identifier, 'A', 'B, etc
343        Returns:
344            DisulfideList containing disulfides within that chain.
345        '''
346        
347        reslist = DisulfideList([], chain)
348        sslist = self.data
349
350        for ss in sslist:
351            pchain = ss.proximal_chain
352            dchain = ss.distal_chain
353            if pchain == dchain:
354                if pchain == chain:
355                    reslist.append(ss)
356            else:
357                print(f'Cross chain SS: {ss.repr_compact}:')
358        return reslist

Return a DisulfideList from the input chain identifier.

Arguments: chain: str - chain identifier, 'A', 'B, etc Returns: DisulfideList containing disulfides within that chain.

def build_torsion_df(self) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
364    def build_torsion_df(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
365        '''
366        Create a dataframe containing the input DisulfideList torsional parameters,
367        ca-ca distance, energy, and phi-psi angles. This can take a while for the
368        entire database.
369
370        :param SSList: DisulfideList - input list of Disulfides
371        :return: pandas.Dataframe containing the torsions
372        '''
373        # create a dataframe with the following columns for the disulfide 
374        # conformations extracted from the structure
375        
376        SS_df = pd.DataFrame(columns=Torsion_DF_Cols)
377        sslist = self.data
378
379        pbar = tqdm(sslist, ncols=_PBAR_COLS)
380        for ss in pbar:
381            new_row = [ss.pdb_id, ss.name, ss.proximal, ss.distal, ss.chi1, ss.chi2, 
382                    ss.chi3, ss.chi4, ss.chi5, ss.energy, ss.ca_distance,
383                    ss.psiprox, ss.psiprox, ss.phidist, ss.psidist, ss.torsion_distance]
384            # add the row to the end of the dataframe
385            SS_df.loc[len(SS_df.index)] = new_row
386        
387        return SS_df

Create a dataframe containing the input DisulfideList torsional parameters, ca-ca distance, energy, and phi-psi angles. This can take a while for the entire database.

Parameters
  • SSList: DisulfideList - input list of Disulfides
Returns

pandas.Dataframe containing the torsions

def build_distance_df(self) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
393    def build_distance_df(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
394        """
395        Create a dataframe containing the input DisulfideList ca-ca distance, energy. 
396        This can take several minutes for the entire database.
397
398        :return: DataFrame containing Ca distances
399        :rtype: pd.DataFrame
400        """
401        
402        # create a dataframe with the following columns for the disulfide 
403        # conformations extracted from the structure
404        
405        SS_df = pd.DataFrame(columns=Distance_DF_Cols)
406        sslist = self.data
407
408        pbar = tqdm(sslist, ncols=_PBAR_COLS)
409        for ss in pbar:
410            new_row = [ss.pdb_id, ss.name, ss.proximal, ss.distal, ss.energy, ss.ca_distance]
411            # add the row to the end of the dataframe
412            SS_df.loc[len(SS_df.index)] = new_row
413        
414        return SS_df

def minmax_distance(self): 
416    def minmax_distance(self):
417        """
418        """
419        distance_df = self.build_distance_df()
420        distance_df.sort_values(by=['ca_distance'], ascending=True, inplace=True)
421        ssmin_id = distance_df.iloc[0]['ss_id']
422        ssmax_id = distance_df.iloc[-1]['ss_id']
423
424        ssmin = self.get_by_name(ssmin_id)
425        ssmax = self.get_by_name(ssmax_id)
426
427        return ssmin, ssmax
def get_torsion_array(self): 
433    def get_torsion_array(self):
434        """
435        Returns an rows X 5 array representing the dihedral angles
436        in the given disulfide list.
437
438        """
439        sslist = self.data
440        tot = len(sslist)
441        res = numpy.zeros(shape=(tot, 5))
442
443        for idx, ss in zip(range(tot), sslist):
444            row = ss.torsion_array
445            res[idx] = row
446        return res

Returns an rows X 5 array representing the dihedral angles in the given disulfide list.

def Torsion_RMS(self): 
448    def Torsion_RMS(self):
449        '''
450        Calculate the RMS distance in torsion space between all pairs in the
451        DisulfideList
452        '''
453        sslist = self.data
454        tot = len(sslist)
455
456        totsq = 0.0
457        for ss1 in sslist:
458            tors1 = ss1.torsion_array
459            total1 = 0
460            for ss2 in sslist:
461                tors2 = ss2.torsion_array
462                total1 += proteusPy.dist_squared(tors1, tors2)
463        
464            totsq = totsq + (total1 / tot)
465
466        return(math.sqrt(totsq/tot**2))

Calculate the RMS distance in torsion space between all pairs in the DisulfideList

def display(self, style='sb'): 
504    def display(self, style='sb'):

508        pl.add_camera_orientation_widget()
509        pl.enable_anti_aliasing('msaa')
510        pl.link_views()
511        pl.reset_camera()
512        pl.show()
def screenshot(self, style='bs', fname='sslist.png', verbose=True):

516            Save the interactive window displaying the list of disulfides in the given style.
517            Argument:
518                self

def display_overlay( self, screenshot=False, movie=False, verbose=True, fname='ss_overlay.png'): 
543    def display_overlay(self, screenshot=False, movie=False, 
544                        verbose=True,
545                        fname='ss_overlay.png'):
546        ''' 
547        Display all disulfides in the list overlaid in stick mode against
548        a common coordinate frames. This allows us to see all of the disulfides
549        at one time in a single view. Colors vary smoothy between bonds.
550        
551        Arguments:
552            PDB_SS: DisulfideLoader object initialized with the database.
553            pdbid: the actual PDB id string
554
555        Returns: None.    
556        ''' 
557        id = self.pdb_id
558        ssbonds = self.data
559        tot_ss = len(ssbonds) # number off ssbonds
560
561        tot_ss = len(ssbonds) # number off ssbonds
562        title = f'Disulfides for SS list {id}: ({tot_ss} total)'
563
564        if movie:
565            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=WINSIZE, off_screen=True)
566        else:
567            pl = pv.Plotter(window_size=WINSIZE, off_screen=False)
568
569        pl.add_title(title=title, font_size=FONTSIZE)
570        pl.enable_anti_aliasing('msaa')
571        pl.add_axes()
572
573        mycol = numpy.zeros(shape=(tot_ss, 3))
574        mycol = proteusPy.cmap_vector(tot_ss)
575
576        for i, ss in zip(range(tot_ss), ssbonds):
577            color = [int(mycol[i][0]), int(mycol[i][1]), int(mycol[i][2])]
578            ss._render(pl, style='plain', bondcolor=color, translate=False)
579
580        pl.reset_camera()
581
582        if screenshot:
583            pl.show(auto_close=False) # allows for manipulation
584            pl.screenshot(fname)
585        elif movie:
586            if verbose:
587                print(f'Saving mp4 animation to: {fname}')
588                
589            pl.open_movie(fname, quality=9)
590            path = pl.generate_orbital_path(n_points=360)
591            pl.orbit_on_path(path, write_frames=True)
592            pl.close()
593
594            if verbose:
595                print(f'Saved mp4 animation to: {fname}')
596        else:
597            pl.show()
598        
599        return

Display all disulfides in the list overlaid in stick mode against a common coordinate frames. This allows us to see all of the disulfides at one time in a single view. Colors vary smoothy between bonds.

Arguments: PDB_SS: DisulfideLoader object initialized with the database. pdbid: the actual PDB id string

Returns: None.
